title: How has been your experience with Springboard Data Science Course in India? - Quora

response.answer_text: For me it has been a great experience given that I could transition into a new job after halfway through the program with a salary that was at par with my skills. To keep it simple, I'll focus on the salient points. The curriculum covers a huge chunk of things you're likely to work on and come across in the workplace. Having said that, some of things learnt are more specific to the kind of industry you're in and the kind of job role you have so you do not need to worry about ‘missing’ out. There will always be more to learn either way.The assigned mentor is very very helpful. You need to make sure to build a connection with them as they can help you even after graduating. Not only can they help you optimize your code, they can also help in inculcating best practices prevalent in the industry.The career coaches are there to help you even after you graduate for a certain period of time. Make sure to utilize their time judiciously as you want to build a job hunt strategy. Think of job hunting as a process, not just a single step, and you will not be disappointed.Overall, I am certain if you have been careful in curating your journey through the course, it'll be fruitful at the end. Identify and decide your goals from the get-go, be it for knowledge upgrading or job change. For me, it was to switch into a career in analytics and the course was holistic enough to make it happen in 3 months (needless to say, I also had to work my rear off in a short time period). The mentors and career coaches were excellent with rich knowledge about the field and the market so you should be sorted there.

How and why did you choose Springboard as your partner for your learning journey? While researching on the data science courses available, one of my friends suggested me the Springboard course and on comparing this with some other university programs i discovered this would be the right fit for me as a learning program. The program is a perfect mix of curated curriculum, coding practice exercises, mini projects, capstone projects, assistance by expert Teaching Assistants, guidance from mentors who are Industry experts and Job Assistance. The program is well spaced across 6–9 months. How has been your overall experience with Springboard? My overall experience with Springboard has been very good so far. I have found the curriculum, projects and mentor support quite useful. The career services team also does a good job on building the overall profile. How has the Springboard mentor helped in shaping your learning? Springboard mentors come with varied experience of driving data science projects in industry from various sectors such as Banking, FMCG, Healthcare, etc. The mentor guides you in the right direction and helps you prep for entering/transitioning into the data science industry and their perspectives are quite useful for taking the right direction in the learning process. How has the Springboard career coach helped you when it comes to aligning your career/job with the skill you learnt/are learning? One of Springboards offering is the Career Services which help in getting interview calls and preparing you for job interviews. The career services go through the student’s profile and skills along with skills from curriculum thoroughly to assess suitability to industries and available roles, build your LinkedIn profile and resume and conduct mock interviews. They have some really good career coaches for providing this support. How has been the Springboard support system(Student Operations/Student Advisors, Teaching Assistants or TA & community helping them) for you? Springboard’s support system helps you keep the learning process in track and provides you with all the necessary operational support for moving forward in the curriculum. One of the offerings they have is the online classroom and office hours is coordinated and arranged by the team. The TA helps with clearing doubts for the students which keep the progress going.
